docs.snippet: After a tumultuous stretch of gaffes and falling poll numbers for Donald Trump, top GOP campaign and party officials insisted Sunday that their presidential nominee is getting back on track and will catch up with Democrat Hillary Clinton by around...
docs.lead_paragraph: After a tumultuous stretch of gaffes and falling poll numbers for Donald Trump, top GOP campaign and party officials insisted Sunday that their presidential nominee is getting back on track and will catch up with Democrat Hillary Clinton by around Labor Day.

headline.main: Campaign, Party Officials Insist Trump Getting Back on Track
headline.print_headline: Campaign, Party Officials Insist Trump Getting Back on Track

docs.snippet: Democratic mega-donors, including George Soros and Tom Steyer, are putting millions of dollars into efforts to put Hillary Clinton in the White House and win control of the Senate. Their investment comes as Republicans worry about not only the cha...
docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic mega-donors, including George Soros and Tom Steyer, are putting millions of dollars into efforts to put Hillary Clinton in the White House and win control of the Senate. Their investment comes as Republicans worry about not only the chances of their nominee Donald Trump, but also his effect on down-ballot races.

headline.main: Democratic Donors Step Up Efforts on Senate, Clinton Bids
headline.print_headline: Democratic Donors Step Up Efforts on Senate, Clinton Bids

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton heads into the fall out front in enough states to give her at least a tie in the Electoral College, meaning a victory in any of the several states now a toss-up would be enough to push her over the top and into the White House....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton heads into the fall out front in enough states to give her at least a tie in the Electoral College, meaning a victory in any of the several states now a toss-up would be enough to push her over the top and into the White House.

headline.main: How AP Rates the Presidential Race and the Road to 270
headline.print_headline: How AP Rates the Presidential Race and the Road to 270

docs.snippet: A senior aide to U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump signaled a possible shift in his hardline immigration policies on Sunday, saying his plans to deport 11 million people who are in the country illegally were under review....
docs.lead_paragraph: A senior aide to U.S. Republican presidential nominee Donald Trump signaled a possible shift in his hardline immigration policies on Sunday, saying his plans to deport 11 million people who are in the country illegally were under review.

headline.main: Trump Campaign Signals Possible Shift on Immigration Stance
headline.print_headline: Trump Campaign Signals Possible Shift on Immigration Stance

docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton "owes the state of North Carolina a very big apology," Donald Trump thundered, condemning the loss of manufacturing jobs due to free-trade deals supported by the Democratic presidential nominee....
docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton "owes the state of North Carolina a very big apology," Donald Trump thundered, condemning the loss of manufacturing jobs due to free-trade deals supported by the Democratic presidential nominee.

headline.main: North Carolina a Snapshot of Trump's Shrinking Trade Appeal
headline.print_headline: North Carolina a Snapshot of Trump's Shrinking Trade Appeal

docs.snippet: President Barack Obama returned from vacation Sunday, ready for a busy fall season and more battles with Congress over Zika funding, the federal budget and $400 million the administration paid Iran this year for the never-completed sale of militar...
docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama returned from vacation Sunday, ready for a busy fall season and more battles with Congress over Zika funding, the federal budget and $400 million the administration paid Iran this year for the never-completed sale of military equipment.

headline.main: Obama Eyes Busy Fall After Return From Summer Vacation
headline.print_headline: Obama Eyes Busy Fall After Return From Summer Vacation
